page.title: 02DATCHET
page.content: Datchet is still a village centred round a green although most of its inhabitants commute daily to London. Founded in Celtic times on a stretch of land slightly higher than the river and marshes,Datchet had little room to expand.The M4 motorway now performs a similar function. The village has both a primary and a secondary school ,large recreational fields with a childrens' playground, several pubs,a number of shops and near the centre of the village, St.Mary's church. For those who wish to travel from Datchet to Windsor the most memorable part of Datchet is the railway level crossing which regularily causes traffic congestion. .
